meanings.definition: A person, thing, or circumstance causing inconvenience or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: The loud construction noise outside my window was a real nuisance.
meanings.sent2: The barking dog next door is such a nuisance.
meanings.sent3: The persistent fly buzzing around the room was a nuisance during the meeting.
meanings.sent4: Her constant complaining became a nuisance that I couldn't ignore.
meanings.sent5: The dripping faucet was a small nuisance that grew into a major annoyance over time.

meanings.definition: An obnoxious or annoying person or thing.
meanings.sent1: The neighbor's loud music was a real nuisance last night.
meanings.sent2: The class clown can be a real nuisance during lessons.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stealing birdseed from the feeder was a little nuisance.
meanings.sent4: Her constant interruptions in class were a nuisance to the teacher.
meanings.sent5: The persistent telemarketer was a nuisance that wouldn't go away.

meanings.definition: An act or instance of causing inconvenience or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: The power outage was a major nuisance during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The long line at the grocery store was a minor nuisance.
meanings.sent3: The spilled coffee on my shirt was a nuisance before the important meeting.
meanings.sent4: The sudden rain shower was a nuisance for the outdoor event.
meanings.sent5: The broken elevator was a huge nuisance for the residents of the building.
